item.title: Character encoding bits
item.description: So I was just hanging around a discord group when someone asked this: What's the minimum number of bits I can use to encode an arbitrary ASCII string 8 characters long that only contains capital letters and numbers? I'm coming up with 42, but that seems like too many. Maybe my intuition for this is just wrong So how did he come up with 42? He's basically asking he as a set of 36 possibilities for a character (26+10) and the length of the string he wants to fit those characters in is 8 characters long.
